STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 9, 2022
Brandon Hannah
Ennis Center for Children - Howell
1221 Byron Road Suite 2
Howell, MI 48843
RE: License #: CB470410104
Ennis Center for Children - Howell
1221 Byron Road Suite 2
Howell, MI 48843
Dear Mr. Hannah:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
05/04/2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(b) Documentation that the foster parent is willing to
accept the foster child.
T h r e e o f t h r ee Borrowed beds records reviewed, three did not
document the foster parent is willing to accept the foster child.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MSA violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-08E Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary.
Completion Requirements:
The caseworker must complete the DHS-69, Foster
Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary, and upload to
MiSACWIS within the timeframe required for the specified
change.
 Within three business days of foster care or juvenile
justice program or case closure.
Two of two closed foster child records reviewed did not show
documentation of the DHS-69 for the child’s respective case
closure.
4

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has not submitted corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. This was an original license.
VI. DCWL FIELD ANALYST FINDING:
The Analyst’s inspection found two safety alerts.
Safety Alert one was issued on 04/20/22.
Concern:
There is a bedroom located in the basement. The bedroom does not have a means
of egress.
Resolution:
04/21/2022 – A special evaluation was opened
04/22/2022 – Licensing worker called to inform the family of the special evaluation.
04/27/2022 – Home visit was completed. Foster Parents agreed to take the bed
down and have this completed over the weekend of 04/30/22- 05/01/22.
05/05/2022 – Home visit confirmed that that bed is removed/taken down.
5

Safety Alert two was issued on 4/26/2022.
Concern: Attempt contacts were made to visit the foster home on 4/7, 4/8, 4/12 and
4/14/2022, to no avail.
Resolution:
Face to face contact was made with the foster parent and children placed in the
home on 4/26/2022 by the agency. There were no concerns for the safety of the
children.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Ennis for Children - Howell
will be issued a Regular License.
05/09/2022
________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 9, 2022
